10

Senate derails 'Buffett rule'

Republicans defied President Obama on a signature issue, a bill that would have made the nation's top earners pay at least 30 percent of income in taxes. (AP)
116th Boston Marathon

Dozens of runners felled by record heat

About 50 people were taken to hospitals by ambulance as temperatures rose to 87 in Boston, breaking the previous record for the day. (Boston Globe)
  • Medical tent busy tending cases of heat exhaustion
  • Boston temps break record; other areas climb into 90s

Globe critic Wesley Morris wins criticism Pulitzer Prize

The Boston Globe film critic won the 2012 Pulitzer Prize for criticism, winning for a range of movie reviews and essays from 2011. (Globe, 5:37 p.m.)

Pedroia stands up for teammate Youkilis

Dustin Pedroia reacted to critical comments manager Bobby Valentine made about Kevin Youkilis, saying "that's not the way we go about our stuff around here." (Globe, 12 p.m.)

editorial

Marathon: Drop the Boston asterisk

Under prevailing rules, world records can’t be set on a course where the elevation drops as much, or where the start and finish lines are as far apart, as in Boston.
G cover

Collateral damage

Drugs that target high cholesterol come with new cautions.
opinion | Adrian Walker

Vince Wilfork’s worthy cause

The Patriots star has used his fame and fortune to raise money and awareness for diabetes research, a disease that has taken a toll on his own family.

A new book looks at the history of America’s ‘most fought-over food.’

AVEO to bring first drug to market

AVEO Pharmaceuticals plans to apply for federal approval of its first drug, for kidney cancer, and is set to add 120 new employees in 2012.
Globe Magazine

In an artist’s garden

Whimsical, handmade creations decorate the grounds at this summer cottage beside the Westport River.

This is not a test

When the tsunami alarms sounded last week in Indonesia, what didn’t happen became an invaluable lesson in disaster management.

News

Fire in Philadelphia kills four

Fire tore through a two-story home early today, killing two young children and two adults in the city's third fatal blaze in one week. Firefighters declared the fire under control in less than 45 minutes, but found no smoke detectors.

Travel

Historic Boston walking tour

Welcome to Boston.com's GPS tour of historical sites in Boston. The city is full of history, and it's a city that is easily seen on foot. This historic walk is a relatively quick and easy way to visit a number of historic sites in the downtown area.

big picture

Earth Day 2012

Earth Day will be celebrated for the 42nd year on April 22. The original grass-roots movement helped spur the Clean Water Act and Clean Air Act in the United States.
